definition: position in a ranking of names/place/rank
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
next in sequence/second/the second (day, time etc)/secondary/vice-/sub-/infra-/inferior quality/substandard/order/sequence/hypo- (chemistry)/classifier for enumerated events: time

sentences.english: We were a bit unlucky but still a good place to finish.
sentences.chinese: 我有些不走運，但還是以不錯的名次完賽了。

sentences.english: If the ranking of homing pigeons is not full, prize of other rankings shall be equally allocated by winning pigeons.
sentences.chinese: 如歸巢獲名次未滿剩餘名次獎金由獲獎鴿均分。

sentences.english: If the ranking of homing pigeons is not full, prize of other rankings shall be equally allocated by winning pigeons.
sentences.chinese: 如歸巢獲名次未滿剩餘名次獎金由獲獎鴿均分。

sentences.english: The correlation coefficient between the rates of error and the team ranking is negative.
sentences.chinese: 失誤率與名次的相關係數均爲負值。

sentences.english: The U.K. wasn't the only country that struggled to keep its ranking.
sentences.chinese: 英國並非唯一一個沒有保住名次的國家。

sentences.english: The first part: All teams are divided into 2 groups using the single round robin rule. The rank is depended on accumulated points.
sentences.chinese: 第一階段分二個小組打單循環賽，按積分算名次。

sentences.english: But that is up from rankings in the 30s two years ago.
sentences.chinese: 但這樣的名次是從兩年前的三十幾名升上來的。

sentences.english: He had entered grueling lumberjack competitions, and had placed often.
sentences.chinese: 他參加過競爭激烈的伐木工大賽，也經常獲得名次。

sentences.english: If again equal, then the position juxtaposes.
If you have to give you more place to play for an hour.
sentences.chinese: 你要是得名次就給你多玩一個小時。

sentences.english: Xinzhu was rated the most liveable place behind Taipei, followed by Tainan and Taizhong cities.
sentences.chinese: 新竹的名次僅次於臺北，接著是臺南及臺中市。

sentences.english: We are in the second place in the table of ranking.
sentences.chinese: 在名次表裏，我們排在第二位。

sentences.english: He has dropped back to the fifth in his class.
sentences.chinese: 他在班內名次退居第五。

sentences.english: Two weeks later, the names of the team runners were called.
sentences.chinese: 天，長跑隊的名次被確定下來。

sentences.english: Guangzhou ranks first in the number of restaurants and tea-houses in the country.
sentences.chinese: 廣州名次熬頭，在茶餐廳和一些在該國的房屋。

sentences.english: She rose to near the top of the world table tennis rankings.
sentences.chinese: 她的名次逐漸上升，一度接近乒乓球世界排名首位。

definition: ranking/ordered list/top 20/roll of honor/to come nth out of 100
to rank (number 1, or third last etc)/to be among (those who are in a particular group)
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees
to compete/to take part in a competition
place (in numbered sequence)/degree on employment scale
quota/number of places/place (in an institution, a group etc)
integral (calculus)/accumulated points (in sports, at school etc)/total credits earned by student/bonus points in a benefit scheme
